name: 2-day Practical Performance at Lopez Canyon Shooting Park
content: PRICE LISTED FOR CLASS INCLUDES ALL APPLICABLE RANGE FEES FOR STUDENT. Cancellations after 2/15/22 will result in a $250 withdrawal fee if the slot cannot be filled. If you cancel your registration prior to that date, you may receive your payment refunded, less a 3% transaction fee charged by payment processing company. Curriculum: Space allowing, we will set up a full stage, for students to run through at the beginning of class. The stage will include a number of elements such as entries and exits, opportunities to shoot on the move, awkward positions, close and far targets, and high risk arrays. This first run through will be an assessment tool, helping the instructor to figure out your shooting style and where improvements can be made. Throughout the class we will occasionally revisit this stage, and use parts of it to isolate and develop skills, and set up drills. Classes consist of 10-13 students, and are two days long. Classes are focused on the practical shooting skills that will help you more confidently plan, tackle, and shave time from your performance with a pistol. While this class does contain some advanced fundamentals, the class is mostly dynamic and stage oriented. Because this class doesn’t include a great deal of “firing line” type fundamentals training, we wont burn through ammo like a regular class. Therefore, the round counts are bit lower than what you might have seen at traditional 2-day classes in the past – we will make them count. I am a firm believer that when it comes to proper practice, quality is much more important than quantity, so this class will also cover principles of efficient practice, and how to structure your practices to identify and address your weaknesses. Students should plan on bringing a lunch. In addition, we'll be covering: Day 1 1. Overview of gear setup/optimization 2. Small discussion on grip/stance/draws 3. Group shooting 4. Dot drills w/o timer and w/ timer 5. Discussion/demo on importance of trigger control and sight management 6. Strong hand and weak hand shooting 7. Transitions 8. Sight deviation and acceptable risk 9. Shot calling 10. Putting it all together (4 aces, El Prez, Accelerator) Day 2 1. Movement (side to side, downrange/uprange) 2. Positioning and how to set up properly (barricades, ports, leans) 3. Entries/Exits 4. Importance of having gun up ready to shoot ALWAYS 5. Stage planning (visualization, self talk) 6. Stage shooting and performance improvement and evaluation

CQB in and of itself is advanced. Basic fundamentals of marksmanship, communication, individual mobility, and team work are all that is needed; the advanced quality of CQB is due to the requirement to apply all of these basic tasks in a furiously fast and complex environment while remaining composed.

“Why do I need training in CQB if that is not my job?”

Conducting tactically sound movement in and around a structure that allows for a deadly ambush at any moment, while carrying and safely manipulating a deadly weapon, while also remaining aware of multiple moving elements such as threats and your team mates, will definitely enhance your survivability and capabilities to save others despite your profession! That is why.

Bottom line: Become hyper aware and also extremely confident in your abilities with a firearm.

name: Close Quarters Marksmanship
content:
The Close Quarters Marksmanship course is a 2-day event focusing on the use and application of fundamentals and tactics in a close range environment, designed to teach shooters skills necessary to be successful in Close Range Marksmanship and CQB. Skills will be presented on a flat range to allow shooters to focus on the individual tasks in a building block methodology. This is the same methodology employed by Tier 1 Special Operations Units when training Operators before they are taught to enter rooms.

**All courses are in a layered, building block format. Progression of the listed tasks is dependent on the student’s ability to absorb and apply instruction. Because of this, we cannot guarantee that all training topics will be covered or that we will not progress past them on to more topics not listed.**

Attendees must be able to perform basic weapons operations, demonstrate safe weapons handling, and correct malfunctions without major error and without assistance.

name: Combat Combine
content:

While this course focuses on the AR15 family of weapons, all semi auto weapons systems are welcome. You will engage targets from zero to 300 meters and beyond(range depending), use cover,and perform under stress. This is not a shoot-til-you-puke course, you will be required to think and concentrate while negotiating courses of fire, but don’t worry; your barrel will get smoking hot too. You will make shots from positions and distances you may have never considered and leave with the confidence and mindset necessary to prevail and return home safely.

name: Max Ordinate Competition Prep Series: "Performance Multiplier"
content:
The Competition Course 1 is the first course in the Max Ordinate competition training series for shooters seeking to master skills needed to compete in tactical style precision rifle matches. This is a single day training evolution focusing on implementing marksmanship fundamentals, competitor mindset, stage breakdown, operating within the rules, gear usage and limitations, supported positions, scope and reticle usage, and creating a basic foundation which the shooter can continue to build on as he or she progresses over time. Bad habits do not get better over time so we stress perfect practice, analyzing stages, video breakdown, and ultimately building confidence.

This course is medium paced but not focused on time as much as a standard. The course curriculum is designed to present the appropriate amount of information with a quick transition to range time that allows for a smooth flow and immediate practical application. Students will be expected to have a basic understanding of rifle operation and arrive at the training facility with a good zero and accurate muzzle velocity. Prior attendance at Max Ordinate courses is not required but PR 1 is recommended.

content:
"Apothecary" is an ancient term for those who produce healing remedies from raw materials. In times of old, local healers would go to the apothecary to obtain the healing remedies they give to their patients. This course takes you far beyond theory and deep into the world of plant processing. We will turn natural plants, oils, waxes, and more into a wide array of healing remedies. You will make your own natural remedies and take them home at the end of the course.

*Each student will leave with several jars/packages of natural remedies they make themselves by hand on the course. Just like the ones pictured above.

During this hands on course you will:

*Learn about the active chemicals in each plant/herb we use, their effects on the body, and how to process the plant for maximum effectiveness.

*Make your own healing balm/lotion

*Make a medicinal poultice/plaster

*Make a medicinal liniment

*Brew a medicinal tea

*Make a disinfecting rinse (oral and wounds)

*Learn to harvest and "cure" wild herbs aka "wildcrafting"

and more!

name: Coyne Survival Schools-Critical Survival Skills Weekend
content:
This is the outdoor survival course everybody should take once, no matter what your skill level. In an emergency, it's knowing the fundamentals that will save you, and here at TCSS we've taken them to a whole new level. This scenario based training course covers the most essential skills to survival in the outdoors, while challenging you to problem solve and perform. Yes you may bring food and a sleeping bag, but we will take you out of your comfort zone on this course and push you to succeed. In survival, success is your only option.

Go beyond the YouTube videos and reality shows with our expert instructors and learn what it truly takes to survive an outdoor emergency. Our curriculum is based on life saving techniques to be employed in real life wilderness survival scenarios and has set a new standard in the field. This course will be fully outdoors no matter what the weather, and is 100% hands on.

Tents are allowed though students have the option to sleep in actual survival shelters they make themselves from the environment. We provide all survival gear to train with, just bring a pocket knife.

*Train in emergency scenarios and learn to respond-and not panic- when things wrong.

*Learn to recognize and treat exposure (hypo/hyperthermia), the   #1 killer in outdoor survival situations

*Learn how to pack for the outdoors and form real world survival and medical kits

*Form a bow and drill friction fire kit (make a fire with sticks)

*Learn emergency all-weather fire making techniques

*Construct a weatherproof survival shelter

*Learn essential first aid skills like how to stop bleeding

*Learn to locate and purify water in the field

*Learn emergency signaling techniques (air & ground) for rescue

*Understand common wilderness emergencies & their causes

*Produce cordage (string/rope) from wild plants                      

*Learn how to react to dangerous snakes & animals

...and much more!

name: Defensive Handgun 1
content:
8-10 Hours, 300 rounds recommended.

This course introduces the student to techniques applicable to defensive use of the handgun. Emphasis is put on shooting skill development for application in real-life circumstances. The fundamentals of Mindset, Gun-handling, and Marksmanship are covered in lecture while the practical aspects are taught on the range.

Other course topics include Situational Awareness, equipment selection, safety, handling, loading, unloading, malfunction clearance, drawing and firing techniques, single handed firing, firing from cover, multiple targets, movement, and tactics. This course will qualify the student for a Concealed Carry License / Concealed Weapons Permit.

name: Defensive Shotgun
content:
8-10 Hours, 120 Rounds as specified

This course addresses the safe and effective employment of the defensive shotgun. Topics include: defensive mindset, safety, handling, gauges, action types, sighting systems, loading, unloading, reloading, select loading, patterning, slug zero, carry methods, ready positions, cover and concealment, and tactics. Shooting is conducted from 1 to 100 yards and scenarios utilizing outdoor simulators are extensively used.

A 12 or 20 gauge short barreled, repeater with rifle or ghost ring sights is ideal, but any shotgun capable of multiple shots will suffice. A butt cuff or side-saddle ammunition carrier is suggested as spare ammunition on the gun is very helpful. A sling is also strongly recommended.

name: DT Pistol 2: Pistol Skills & Firing Techniques

Pistol Skills and Firing Techniques is the next and final step in our basic civilian handgun fundamental training series. Graduates of the Pistol 1:  Pistol Safety & Fundamentals Course are invited to participate in this next series of drills such as dry fire warm up, static line warm up, moving and shooting, and much more. This course consists of 1 hour of range safety briefing followed by 3 hours of drills at the range.  This course is a prerequisite to register for our Pistol 3: Intermediate Civilian Handgun Course and Range Day for Pistol course.

**NO REVOLVERS**

Requirements:

Students must be 18 years of age or older and must have successfully completed our Pistol 1:  Basic Civilian Handgun Introductory Course before taking this next level course.

Students will be required to demonstrate basic firearms safety, marksmanship, and competence in loading and unloading a firearm. The course is a total of 4 hours. The first hour includes a refresher, safety, and range-rules briefing. From there, you will transition to the firing line for the final 3 hours of defensive tactics training and live-fire drills.

Items required in order to participate in this course:

name: MV Tactical Advanced Defensive Pistol
content:
Objective: The next training progression for students who have completed Intermediate Defensive Pistol or an equivalent course. Students will refine their shooting accuracy, recoil control and speed, and further develop their tactical mindset. We’ll emphasize maximizing the use of cover, shooting on the move and engaging threats that present from different directions.

name: R.A.I.D. Warrior Program
content:
The Responsive Actions and Integrated Disciplines (R.A.I.D.)  Tactical Engagement Systems Warrior Program is a training and whole life conditioning program designed for those that want to train and master the fighting arts in modern times. The R.A.I.D. Tactical Engagement System was developed over years of study, combat, training, and mastering the skills needed to not only fight in modern combat on the battlefield but also to train others the same systems for their survival. This system relies on the individual to master the individual skills of multiple weapons systems, but also themselves and their mindset to overcome adversity and challenge. No one is perfect or knows everything, but with the support of other Warriors training together, we learn the art of fighting is not just about the individual but the team. When we as Warriors bring strong individual skills to the fight, we then come together as a team with strong team skills that prove nothing is impossible. The impossible just takes a while to accomplish. We cannot do it alone, we cannot do it with the wrong mindset, we cannot do it without support for and from others. We do it together. Each Warrior is a link in the fighting chain, a cog in the wheel of the machine that moves the fight to the enemy, that builds Initiative that cannot be overcome. But it takes each individual Warrior to do his part, to train as hard as he can, to build the strength he needs to hold the line, to hold the standard. The helmet he wears is to protect himself, the Sword he carries is to kill his enemy, the shield he carries is for the man next to him. To protect his fellow Warrior in the fray, when they stand together to form and hold the line.

The R.A.I.D Warrior program is not for everyone. It is for the few that, no matter where they are in life, have decided to stand with others and train the skills of battle. To test themselves against others, with others, for others. This program is not for the faint at heart or the weak. Physical Strength can be built, endurance can be trained but courage cannot. It can only be tested. The R.A.I.D. Warrior program is for those people that want to test themselves, train themselves and test against and with others.

When a person commits to the R.A.I.D. Warrior Program they are committing to themselves to be a better person- Physically, Mentally, and Spiritually- and members of the community.

All that enroll and follow the R.A.I.D. Warrior Program will receive discounts on training courses. Discounts on Matches, Individual and group training, and fellowship into the Warrior Culture. Only you can decide to join, only you can reap the benefits of the skills of battle. Starting at THE BASIC LEVEL is the first step to Master. All Masters started as beginners, and thru hard work, persistence, and suffering they became Masters, mentors, trainers, and
